title: APT / REAL ESTATE AGENT
description: A short conversation with the real estate agent. She tells you about some apartments.

dialogueTree.title: Real Estate Agent: ""What now?" She crosses her arms im..."
dialogueTree.text: "What now?" She crosses her arms impatiently.

links.title: You: ""What are you doing here?""
links.text: "What are you doing here?"

links.title: Real Estate Agent: "She sighs and looks around. "I need..."
links.text: She sighs and looks around. "I need to get it ready for the next lease, but as you can see, the previous tenant completely trashed the place."

links.title: You: ""Sounds like they knew how to have..."
links.text: "Sounds like they knew how to have a good time."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""It was some kind of a moribund old..."
links.text: "It was some kind of a moribund old man, who used to be a business owner. You'd think they'd make rent..." She stops, hesitating.

links.title: Composure: "A sudden serious look crosses her f..."
links.text: A sudden serious look crosses her face. This story didn't have a happy ending.

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""But -- that was months ago. Anyway..."
links.text: "But -- that was months ago. Anyway. Was there anything you wanted, or is that it? I'm in a hurry."

links.title: You: ""Reprehensible. Who lived here?""
links.text: "Reprehensible. Who lived here?"

links.title: You: ""I fuck shit up too.""
links.text: "I fuck shit up too."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Heh!" She smiles aggressively. "So..."
links.text: "Heh!" She smiles aggressively. "Sounds like you've spent too much time undercover in some rock band."

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's not a compliment."
links.text: It's not a compliment.

links.title: You: ""Who lived here?""
links.text: "Who lived here?"

links.title: You: ""Isn't it a bit late to be working?""
links.text: "Isn't it a bit late to be working?"

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""It *is*." She breathes in and out..."
links.text: "It *is*." She breathes in and out to the count of three -- it looks like some special stress release technique -- before she continues...

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Everyone says that real estate age..."
links.text: "Everyone says that real estate agents don't *do* anything, but here I am, in the middle of the night, cleaning up someone's 'crash pad'."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""So, the sooner we get this over wi..."
links.text: "So, the sooner we get this over with, the better." She means you -- time for the next question.

links.title: Endurance: "Come to think of it, she *does* loo..."
links.text: Come to think of it, she *does* look incredibly tired.

links.title: You: ""Who lived in the foreclosed apartm..."
links.text: "Who lived in the foreclosed apartment down the hallway?"

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Oh, that's another huge mess. The..."
links.text: "Oh, that's another huge mess. The former tenant owes us three months of rent, *three*! We closed the apartment and planned on auctioning off the valuables, but..."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""And again, I have no idea how *stu..."
links.text: "And again, I have no idea how *stupid* mistakes like this can even happen, but Ron, when he came to close the door, didn't close the neighbouring door! And there's a hole in the wall!"

links.title: Electrochemistry: "So preppy! She's probably on some l..."
links.text: So preppy! She's probably on some low grade performance enhancers. Like Preptide or Pericanine.

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""A hole in the wall, can you believ..."
links.text: "A hole in the wall, can you believe it?" She spreads her hands. "And then the tenant ran off with his stuff. He's gone, the *money's* gone, just like that!" She snaps her fingers.

links.title: Logic: "The sum must've been puny."
links.text: The sum must've been puny.

links.title: Empathy: "Oh, it irks her. The *incompetence*..."
links.text: Oh, it irks her. The *incompetence*.

links.title: You: ""My money has also disappeared, I t..."
links.text: "My money has also disappeared, I think."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Well, it does *not* disappear from..."
links.text: "Well, it does *not* disappear from my hands, no, I don't let it."

links.title: You: ""It couldn't have been that much mo..."
links.text: "It couldn't have been that much money. These apartments look pretty shabby."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""These apartments are perfectly fin..."
links.text: "These apartments are perfectly fine! They have gorgeous architecture, a million reál view of the bay, good ventilation, neighbours, life, spark... And they are affordable."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""I'll tell you, Martinaise has a fu..."
links.text: "I'll tell you, Martinaise has a future -- in a few years it's going to blossom with artists and creatives and those radiocomputer wizards."

links.title: Rhetoric: "The *radiocomputer wizards* are inv..."
links.text: The *radiocomputer wizards* are invested with magical economic powers.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's as if they're *real* wizards,..."
links.text: It's as if they're *real* wizards, able to resurrect dead real estate and breathe life into bank accounts.

links.title: You: ""So wait, what happened with the wa..."
links.text: "So wait, what happened with the wall?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Don't ask me what happened with th..."
links.text: "Don't ask me what happened with the wall, I have no idea how we're going to find the time or resources to fix it."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""*Both* apartments are now unrentab..."
links.text: "*Both* apartments are now unrentable. Both!" She's still shaking her head, manicured hands now crossed over the chest.

links.title: You: ""I glimpsed a *foreclosed* apartmen..."
links.text: "I glimpsed a *foreclosed* apartment down the hallway."

links.title: You: ""That's all, thank you." [Leave.]"
links.text: "That's all, thank you." [Leave.]

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Of course," she replies with a smi..."
links.text: "Of course," she replies with a smile, but her eyes remain glazed over -- she's been waiting for you to leave.

dialogueTree.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Satisfied? My name is Marielle Cha..."
dialogueTree.text: "Satisfied? My name is Marielle Charpentier and I'm an agent with Martinaise Realty Associates. I am *not* breaking in, as I have every *right* to be here. The keys, see?" She jingles a set of keys in her hand.

links.title: Interfacing: "Boy there are a lot of different ke..."
links.text: Boy there are a lot of different keys there. More than *twenty* at least...

links.title: Empathy: "Her voice is really cheerful despit..."
links.text: Her voice is really cheerful despite her obviously *hating* you.

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Do you want to see my ID as well?..."
links.text: "Do you want to see my ID as well? You can't *legally* ask for it, but why not? Want to see my residence permit, too?" She fumbles through her purse, fishing out a light paper-clad passport.

links.title: You: "Inspect the passport."
links.text: Inspect the passport.

links.title: Real Estate Agent: "It feels flimsy in hand, with the w..."
links.text: It feels flimsy in hand, with the words 'Revachol Zone of Control' written under a nondescript municipal logo. There's a picture of her with shorter hair inside, along with all her personal details.

links.title: Suggestion: "Be friendly."
links.text: Be friendly.

links.title: You: ""Nice haircut." (Hand back the pass..."
links.text: "Nice haircut." (Hand back the passport.)

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Thank you." She slips the passport..."
links.text: "Thank you." She slips the passport back in her purse. "Do you have any questions? I need to be back in midtown in an hour."

links.title: You: ""Everything seems to be in order."..."
links.text: "Everything seems to be in order." (Hand back the passport.)

links.title: You: ""I don't need your ID, I just need..."
links.text: "I don't need your ID, I just need to ask you some questions."

links.title: Real Estate Agent: ""Very well, but please make it quic..."
links.text: "Very well, but please make it quick." She slips the passport back to her purse and checks her watch. "I need to be back in La Delta in an hour."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
